item.description: Defensive Programming # Reference # http://teaching.csse.uwa.edu.au/units/CITS1001/handouts/L14-defensive-programming.pdf Rules on how to employ Defensive Programming in your codebase: # Protect your code from invalid data coming from outside, wherever you decide outside is. External systems, files, or any call from outside of the module/component. Establish “trust boundaries” — everything outside of the boundary is dangerous, everything inside of the boundary is safe. In the barricade code, validate all input data. After you have checked for bad data, decide how to handle it.
